title: Protocol for the generation and expansion of human iPS cell-derived ureteric bud organoids
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Maintenance of hiPSCs
Timing: every 4 days
This section describes the maintenance culture of hiPSCs.
Maintenance culture.
Maintain the hiPSCs in feeder-free cultures containing Stem Fit AK02N medium on 6-well plates.
Passage the hiPSCs every four days with no more than 80% confluence.
To passage the hiPSCs, aspirate the medium and wash the cells with 2 mL EDTA (0.5 mM)/PBS. Add 2 mL EDTA/PBS and incubate the cells at 37°C for 3 min.
Critical: Extended exposure (> 10 min) to EDTA/PBS will decrease cell viability and differentiation potential when you passage hiPSCs.
Aspirate the EDTA/PBS and add 2 mL Stem Fit AK02N. Dissociate the cells into single cells by gentle pipetting.
After cell counting, replate the cells at a density of 5 × 104 cells/well in 6-well plates and add 2 mL Stem Fit AK02N medium containing 10 μΜ Y-27632 and 0.125 μg/cm2 iMatrix-511 silk.
Note: We recommend that maintenance medium for hiPSCs be Stem Fit AK02N or AK03N (Ajinomoto) because the induction efficiency of UB lineage cells may be decrease with hiPSCs maintained in other media, such as Essential 8 (Thermo Fisher Scientific).
Note: We add iMatrix-511 silk to the medium to coat the plate at passaging. You may precoat the plate with iMatrix-511 silk at 37°C for 1 h; however, this is a time-consuming process (Miyazaki et al., 2017[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib8]).
Critical: Adding ROCK inhibitor is important to prevent hiPSC apoptosis at passaging.
Preparation of hiPSCs for differentiation
Timing: 1 day for pre-differentiation
This section describes the preparation culture of hiPSCs before differentiation.
Pre-differentiation.
Prepare the hiPSC suspension at passaging.
After cell counting, replate the cells at a density of 2.5 × 104 cells/cm2 and add Stem Fit AK02N medium containing 10 μΜ Y-27632 and 0.125 μg/cm2 iMatrix-511 silk.

Note: hiPSCs will be 30%–40% confluency during pre-differentiation.
Critical: Both confluency and the size of the initial hiPSC colonies should be considered to avoid spontaneous differentiation.
Note: We use two wells of a 4-well culture plate, and the medium volume is 500 μL for a regular differentiation experiment. Other plate formats, such as 24-well plates, can be used alternatively.
Critical: Adding ROCK inhibitor to the medium is important to prevent apoptosis at pre-differentiation.
Incubate the cells at 37°C for 24 h (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]A).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/1739-Fig1.jpg
Figure 1. Induction of iUB organoids
(A) Morphology of hiPSCs 24 h after thawing prior to differentiation.
(B) Morphology of hiPSCs treated with EDTA/PBS for 3 min. The cells must have clearly defined bright edges under a brightfield microscope.
(C) The protocol to differentiate hiPSCs into iUB organoids. APS, anterior primitive streak; AIM, anterior intermediate mesoderm; ND, nephric duct; UB, ureteric bud; A, 100 ng/mL Activin A; C3, 3 μM CHIR99021; F8, 200 ng/mL FGF8; TT, 0.1 μM TTNPB; A83, 1 μM A83-01; LDN, 0.1 μM LDN193189; Y, 10 μM Y-27632; C1, 1 μM CHIR99021; G, 100 ng/mL GDNF; F1, 200 ng/mL FGF1; and E, 50 ng/mL EGF.
(D) Immunostaining of day 3 AIM cells for GATA3 (green), LHX1 (red) and PAX2 (purple).
(E) Immunostaining of day 2 ND elongation cells for GATA3 (green), RET (red) and nuclei (blue).
(F) A schematic showing a ND aggregate (red) and unwanted cells (blue; left panel) and morphology of a day 2 aggregate before (middle panel) and after (right panel) pipetting to remove unwanted cells. The red circles in the middle and right panels indicate a ND aggregate.
(G) Morphology of a day 6 iUB organoid.
(H) Immunostaining of a day 7 iUB organoid for LAMININ (green), EZRIN (red) and nuclei (blue).

(I) Immunostaining of cryosections of a day 7 iUB organoid for CK8 (green), RET (red) and nuclei (blue).
(J) Morphology of a day 6 iUB organoid (upper panel) and tips separated from day 6 iUB organoids (lower panel).
(K) 3D whole-mount immunostaining of a day 14 separated tip-derived iUB organoid for RET (green) and E-CADHERIN (red). Scale bars, 300 μm in (F) and 100 μm in (A)–(E) and (G)–(J). (J) is adapted from Mae et al. (2020)[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib7].
Note: Incubate the cells with EDTA/PBS until the cells have clearly defined bright edges under a brightfield microscope (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]B). The differentiation efficiency might decrease if the cells are treated with EDTA/PBS for >5 min or too short.
Note: We recommend that the maintenance medium for hiPSCs be Stem Fit AK02N or AK03N (Ajinomoto) because the induction efficiency of UB lineage cells may decrease with hiPSCs maintained in other media, such as Essential 8 (Thermo Fisher Scientific).
Nephric duct cell induction in 2D culture
Timing: 16–28 h for APS induction, 3 days for AIM induction and 2 days for ND elongation
This section describes the induction of nephric duct (ND) cells through APS and AIM steps.
APS induction (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]C).
Prepare 1 mL APS medium for two wells of a 4-well plate before starting this step.
After 1 day of pre-differentiation with StemFit AK02N, wash the cells with 500 μL PBS and add 500 μL APS medium per well.
Incubate the cells at 37°C for 16–28 h.
Note: You may need to optimize the incubation time depending on the hiPSC lines. To confirm APS induction, we recommend bright field microscopic observations and immunostaining analysis. Refer to troubleshooting 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting].
AIM induction (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]C).
Prepare 3 mL AIM medium before starting this step.

After 16–28 h of APS induction, wash the cells with 500 μL PBS, add 1 mL AIM medium per well and incubate at 37°C for 2 days without changing the medium.
After 2 days, coat the 24-well plates with 300 μL Geltrex per well and incubate at 37°C for 1 h.
Note: Geltrex is ready-to-use and stored at 4°C until the expiry date indicated on the label. Coat new 24-well plates with undiluted Geltrex. You can use Matrigel alternatively.
Aspirate the AIM medium and wash the cells with 500 μL PBS.
Add 300 μL Accutase per well and incubate the cells at 37°C for 3 min.
Critical: Extended exposure (>3 min) to Accutase will lead to decreased cell viability.
Detach the cells from the plates and dissociate them into single cells by manual pipetting about ten times.
Collect all cell suspensions from all wells in a 15-mL tube and add DMEM/10% FBS up to 1.5 mL/well in the 4-well plates to stop the Accutase activity.
Centrifuge the cells at 200×g for 5 min and aspirate the medium.
After cell counting, replate the cells at a density of 1.0 × 105 cells/cm2 in a Geltrex-coated 24-well plate with 500 μL AIM medium containing 10 μΜ Y-27632 and incubate at 37°C for an additional 24 h.
Note: Immunostaining analysis for GATA3, LHX1 and PAX2 can be performed to confirm AIM induction 72 h later. (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]D). AIM cells co-express these three markers.
ND elongation (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]C).
Prepare 2 mL ND medium to correspond to two wells of a 24-well plate before starting this step.
Wash the AIM cells with 500 μL PBS and add 1 mL ND medium per well of the 24-well plate.
Incubate the cells at 37°C for 2 days without a medium change.

Note: Immunostaining analysis for RET can be performed to confirm ND elongation cell induction. ND elongation cells co-express RET and GATA3 (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]E).
iUB organoid induction in 3D culture
Timing: 2 days for ND epithelialization and 6 days for iUB organoid induction
Timing: 6 days for the reconstitution of iUB organoids
This section describes the induction of iUB organoids through ND epithelialization step and reconstitution of iUB organoids from separated tip regions of iUB organoids.
ND epithelialization (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]C).
Prepare 2 mL ND medium for 20 wells of a 96-well plate before starting this step.
Wash the ND cells with 500 μL PBS per well and then aspirate the PBS.
Add 300 μL Accutase per well and incubate at 37°C for 3 min.
Detach the cells from the plates and dissociate them into single cells by manual pipetting about ten times.
Collect all cell suspensions in a 15-mL tube and add DMEM/10% FBS up to 1.5 mL/well in the 24-well plates to stop the Accutase activity.
Centrifuge the cells at 200×g for 5 min and aspirate the medium.
Note: You can cryopreserve these cells at a density of up to 2 × 106 cells/mL with STEMCELL BANKER.
After resuspending the cells in ND medium and cell counting, seed the cells at a density of 1 × 104 cells/well in low-attachment M-bottom 96-well plates with 100 μL ND medium plus 10 μM Y-27632 and incubate the cells at 37°C for an additional 2 days without a medium change.
Note: After two days, one ND aggregate including unwanted cells is formed per one well of 96-well culture plates.
iUB organoid induction (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]C).
Prepare 2 mL UB organoid medium for 20 wells of a 96-well plate before starting this step.

Separate unwanted cells from ND aggregates by manual pipetting 10–20 times using a 10- or 200-μL pipette (Mae et al., 2018[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib14]) (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]F).
Note: Unwanted cells are not UB lineage and arise in the process of UB differentiation because the induction rate of ND cells is not 100%. We recommend separating these unwanted cells to purify ND cells. The ND cell region is larger and harder than unwanted regions in one aggregate per well (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]F).
Note: If unwanted cells cannot be separated from the ND aggregate, reinduce the ND cells from hiPSCs by improving the APS induction step. Refer to troubleshooting 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting].
Aspirate ND medium and add 100 μL organoid medium per well to the same 96-well plates.
Incubate the aggregates at 37°C for 6 days. Organoid medium is changed every two days to generate iUB organoids (Figures 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]G–1I).
Note: iUB organoids will be floating in the well. One iUB organoid is formed per well of the 96-well plates.
Critical: Excessive pipetting (over 30 times) will break ND aggregates and may decrease UB budding.
Note: M-bottom 96-well plates with spindle-shaped bottoms are recommended to generate iUB organoids. It is difficult to generate ND cell aggregates with U-bottom 96-well plates and to observe cell aggregates by microscopy with V-bottom 96-well plates.
Note: You may centrifuge M-bottom 96-well plates containing ND cells at 200×g for 2 min to promote the cell aggregate formation.
Note: The induction rate of iUB organoids may be low if the budding regions of iUB organoids are reduced and/or thickened. Refer to troubleshooting 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting].
Additional: Reconstitution of iUB organoids from separated tip regions of iUB organoids.
Prepare 2 mL UB organoid medium before starting this step.
Move some iUB organoids to a 35-mm dish (Sumitomo Bakelite) with 2 mL Essential 6 medium.

Prepare two 22G needles (Terumo, # NN-2225R) and a stereomicroscope.
Manually separate the UB tip regions from iUB organoids with two needles using a stereomicroscope (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]J).
Move one separated UB tip region into one well of the low-attachment M-bottom 96-well plates and add 100 μL UB organoid medium per well.
Incubate the aggregate at 37°C for 14 days. Organoid medium is changed every two days to generate iUB organoids (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]K).
Note: This reconstitution process can be repeated 3–4 times for each tip.
2D-CDP induction
Timing: 7 days for UB tip colony induction and 7 days for CDP induction
This section describes the induction of CDPs in 2D culture from iUB organoids through UB tip colonies.
UB tip colony induction (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]A).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/1739-Fig2.jpg
Figure 2. Induction of tip colonies and CDPs
(A) A schematic showing the induction methods for tip colonies and CDPs.
(B) Morphology of day 7 tip colonies.
(C) Immunostaining of a day 7 tip colony for RET (green), GATA3 (red) and nuclei (blue).
(D) Immunostaining of CDPs for FOXA1 (green) and AQP2 (red).
(E) Immunostaining of a day 14 reconstituted iUB organoid for RET (green), CK8 (red) and nuclei (blue).
(F) Immunostaining of a CDP organoid for GATA3 (green), AQP2 (red) and FOXF1 (white). Scale bars, 100 μm. (D) and (F) are adapted from Mae et al. (2020)[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib7].
Prepare 600 μL UB tip medium for two wells of a 48-well plate before starting this step.
Coat the 48-well plate with 150 μL/well hydrogel.
Note: Keep Matrigel and hydrogel on ice to prevent them from solidifying before use. For details, refer to materials and equipment[href=https://www.wicell.org#materials-and-equipment].
Incubate the plate to solidify the hydrogel at 37°C for 1 h.
Collect 10 day 6 iUB organoids in a 1.5 mL tube.
Wash the organoids with 500 μL PBS twice.

Aspirate PBS and add 100 μL Accutase. Incubate at 37°C for 5 min.
Add 900 μL DMEM/F12 containing 10% FBS and dissociate the organoids by manual pipetting about 30 times.
Centrifuge the cells at 200×g for 5 min and aspirate the medium.
After resuspending the cells in 100 μL UB tip medium and cell counting, seed the cells at a density of 5 × 104 cells/cm2 in 48-well plates and add UB tip medium up to 300 μL per well.
Incubate the cells at 37°C for 7 days. Change the medium every two days.
Note: After 7 days, 500–1,000 tip colonies 80–100 μm in diameter will be formed per well.
Note: Immunostaining analysis for RET and GATA3 will help confirm the tip colony induction (Figures 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]B and 2C). Tip colonies co-express these markers.
Note: If UB tip colonies cannot be formed, refer to troubleshooting 4[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting].
2D-CDP induction (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]A).
Prepare 1 mL CDP medium for two wells of a 24-well plate before starting this step.
Aspirate the medium of day 7 UB tip colonies in 48-well plates (see 8. UB tip colony induction of step-by-step method details[href=https://www.wicell.org#step-by-step-method-details]) and add 300 μL Cell Recovery Solution per well.
Incubate the plate at 4°C for 1 h to dissolve hydrogel containing 50% Matrigel.
Collect all cell suspension from the four wells of the 48-well plates into a 1.5 mL tube, centrifuge the colonies at 500×g for 5 min and aspirate the supernatant.
Note: If the hydrogel remains around the UB tip colonies, we recommend adding 1 mL Cell Recovery Solution to the 1.5 mL tube after aspirating the supernatant. Pipet gently three to four times and incubate the cells at 4°C for an additional 1 h.

Wash the cell pellet in the 1.5 mL tube with 1 mL PBS and centrifuge the colonies at 500×g for 5 min.
Aspirate PBS and add 100 μL Accutase in the 1.5 mL tube containing the UB tip colonies. Incubate the cells at 37°C for 5 min.
Add 900 μL DMEM/F12 containing 10% FBS per well and dissociate the colonies by manual pipetting until obtaining a single cell suspension.
Centrifuge the cells at 200×g for 5 min and aspirate the medium.
After resuspending the cells in 100 μL CDP medium and cell counting, seed the cells at a density of 5 × 104 cells/cm2 in 24-well plates with 500 μL CDP medium containing 10 μΜ Y-27632 and 0.125 μg/cm2 iMatrix-511 silk.
Note: We add iMatrix-511 silk to the medium to coat the plate. You may precoat the plate with iMatrix-511 silk at 37°C for 1 h; however, this is a time-consuming process (Miyazaki et al., 2017[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib8].).
Incubate the cells at 37°C for 7 days. Change CDP medium every two days.
Note: Immunostaining analysis for FOXA1 and AQP2 will help confirm CDP induction (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]D). CDPs co-express these markers.
Note: If the induction rate of CDPs is low, refer to troubleshooting 5[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting].
3D-CDP organoid induction
Timing: 14 days for reconstitution of iUB organoids and 14 days for 3D-CDP induction
This section describes the induction of CDPs in 3D culture from UB tip colonies through reconstituted iUB organoids.
Reconstitution of iUB organoids from tip colonies (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]A).
Prepare 2 mL iUB organoid medium to correspond to 10 reconstituted iUB organoids before starting this step.
Aspirate the medium of day 7 UB tip colonies (after finishing 8. UB tip colony induction of step-by-step method details[href=https://www.wicell.org#step-by-step-method-details]) and add 300 μL Cell Recovery Solution per well.

Incubate the cells at 4°C for 1 h to dissolve the hydrogel.
Collect all colony suspensions in a 15-mL tube, centrifuge the cells at 500×g for 5 min and aspirate the supernatant.
Note: If the hydrogel remains around the UB tip colonies, we recommend adding 5 mL Cell Recovery Solution and incubating the cells at 4°C for an additional 1 h.
Wash the colonies with 5 mL PBS twice.
After resuspending the colonies in 2 mL iUB organoid medium, seed the colonies from 10 wells of 48-well plates to one low-attachment 35 mm dish.
Incubate the colonies at 37°C for 14 days. Change iUB organoid medium every two days.
Note: Immunostaining analysis for RET and CK8 may help confirm iUB organoid reconstitution (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]E). The tip and trunk regions of reconstituted iUB organoids express RET and CK8, respectively.
3D-CDP organoid induction (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]A).
Prepare 1 mL CDP medium for 10 3D-CDP organoids before starting this step.
Aspirate the medium of day 14 reconstituted iUB organoids (after finishing 10. Reconstitution of iUB organoids from tip colonies of step-by-step method details[href=https://www.wicell.org#step-by-step-method-details]) and wash the organoids with 2 mL PBS.
Aspirate PBS and add 2 mL CDP medium.
Incubate the cells at 37°C for 14 days. Change CDP medium every two days.
Note: Immunostaining analysis for FOXA1 and AQP2 will help confirm 3D CDP organoids induction (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]F). 3D CDP organoids co-express these markers.
